reviews.review_msg: I really enjoy this class, especially the lectures. They're insightful and quite fun to comprehend. However, be prepared to read BEFORE lectures or else you would grasp half the material covered. I would just say to do the readings no matter how much u hate doing so.

POL 428 - I have taken three classes with Professor McGovern during my time at SFU. Honestly, she was one of my favourite professors. She is very approachable outside of class and is clear with her criteria. She also cares about her students. Her seminars are engaging, but she is a harder grader. Overall, I would take her class again!

Clare creates an engaging dynamic for this 4th-year seminar. Although there are many writings for the course, she is always open to giving feedback and helping you dive into your paper. There is plenty of flexibility to explore your research topic, and the amount of readings is manageable for a writing course.

Clare is knowledgeable and caring. HOWEVER, her expectation is way too high. You have to keep working on many things throughout a whole semester. Particularly for the take-home final, an insane amount of writing to be done and she expects you to remember all the class readings. The workload for her class is double than other profs.
Very tough grader, her assignments are super specific and TA's mark incredibly unfairly, taking off large marks for the smallest mistakes
Clare McGovern is hands down one of the best professor's at sfu. Her knowledge of legal cases and charter facts is brilliant and if you need to take any course with her please do.

Clare is an exceptionally brilliant professor. I never write review on here but i enjoyed taking this class with her. She was always available to answer questions even outside of her office hours. A lot of reading/writing involved but the grading criteria was always clear.
Highly recommend

Attending lec is a waste of time, just don't go, better off doing the assignments at home. Did fairly well in her class, although the TAs, took a huge chunk of marks off, for. the. smallest. reasons. imaginable. just to not give a full mark. NO CLEAR GRADING CRITERIA. No midterm, take-home final exam. Treat the class like a 3rd year course.

I didn't really like Clare's attitude honestly, she knows the class material well and unless you do PERFECT its not good enough for her. Ironically, her classes are so boring and theres so much back and forth between subjects that you can't understand enough to do "perfect". Expect to do put in a lot of effort for a mid/bad grade.

This class should be easy becuase its a 100 level class that is a requirement for most, but Clare makes it unnecessarily hard. I think she has an ego and wants her class to be "important", which makes her care very little about her students. I dont know anyone who did well in her class this semester, the grading was unjustifiably hard.

Clare is very disrespectful if you talk to her in person and will not help you do better in the class unless you are doing HORRIBLY: my friends and I would go in to ask for help on assignments, and if you got an 80 or higher she would talk down to you because she thought it was already a " very good grade for this class".
Very unhelpful and when you try to ask for any sort of help she is extremely rude. Would not take her again.
not helpful what so ever, very rude, does not care about students grades and is a very odd marker, AVOID taking classes with her

This is supposed to be a 1st-year course but it feels like a 4th-year course from the amount of heavy weekly readings to the high expectations for each assignment (Coming from a 3rd-year student with a 4.0 GPA). Assignments are graded harshly without any actual helpful feedback; feels like she wants you to fail rather than succeed.

This class is so heavy for a 100 level course. The amount of content and the way it's taught is just overall too much. She seems alright but is very picky and doesn't know how to create clear slides. They're too messy and she often goes back and forth when it comes to content. The assignments were marked harsh and reading's every week were a lot.

I have a 4.0 GPA and I've never struggled in a class quite like this one. The material was difficult and confusing even when a lot of effort was put in. Dr. McGovern herself was a great professor who was incredibly approachable and kind. I think I perhaps struggled as I am not a political science major although this class did feel harder

Clare is rude and will not help you do better in the class. I went to her office hours to talk about my 80 paper, and all she said was "i think its rude that youre trying to argue an 80 with me, im not going to change my mind. Do you understand that that's a good grade for this class?". This class will just drag down your GPA.

Clare was always willing to help students when they need help. However, I found it hard to follow her lecture slides as they were very boring. Majority of the class stopped showing up halfway through the course.

While Clare seems like a great person, I often found her lectures very hard to follow or stay engaged in. Slides were often complicated with a web of random charts and lines and overall just hard to follow. The way she teaches is as if its expected we already know all the terms, even though it's a first year class. Many mandatory readings as well

the course load of this class is not even close to a typical 100-level, I took it after taking previous law courses but general concepts and definitions were largely left out of lectures to figure out on your own. extremely heavy readings that dont get covered in lecture 90% of the time and the TA's grade extremely harshly.

Do not take this course as a first year student. It requires more than a highschool law class-level of knowledge about the court systems, and as one of the first courses you might take, it's hard to focus in lecture and the information is repetitive and bland. Clare gives help, but honestly you might not know where to start when getting assistance.

The course is unnecessarily hard. On average, class marks would be around 70%, which is ridiculous for a first-year course. There's around 40-60 pages to read a week, sometimes more, and we're expected to prepare summaries for each reading for tutorial. Textbook content was largely left out of lectures. She was accommodating, though.

Clare is nice and approachable for questions but this class is unnecessarily hard for a first year course. It's kinda assumed you know some content on the legal system and it leads to so much confusion. The lectures were really boring and had nothing to do with the textbook. If you don't need this class don't take it.

Clare is a great prof who is very passionate about politics. However, this class is horrible. The material is dry, lectures make content even more confusing, and you have to read between 100-150 pages of readings before every tutorial to get participation marks. Clare gave great feedback on assignments, the content is too difficult for 1st year.

Prof. McGovern is an amazing lecturer who is always available for questions and who is very patient when explaining concepts. Her lectures explained the details of constitutional law in an effective and to-the-point manner. Assignments were easy to understand and really did require an understanding of the course material. Final exam was easy.

Professor McGovern is passionate about what she teaches. The cases we studied were quite interesting and engaging. A fair amount of reading is to be done prior to lecture/tutorial. Clare was very accommodating and understanding. Found that she was an easier marker than some TAs. Final exam was long but open book.

Clare is a nice professor and very passionate about the course material. I found it a bit boring but I like how it was interconnected in some ways with criminology due to the fact that it looks at law. The tests and assignments are quite easy as long as you're able to understand the textbook because they were open book. an A is for sure possible!

Clare is amazing at giving lectures and I found them to be very engaging and insightful. Marking is relatively easy in this course with most be I know pretty easily getting high Bs or low A's. Reading is very important for this class, as is attending tutorials. Overall a very good prof, whom I would very much so recommend.

The class was taken online due to the pandemic. However, Clare kept the live lectures interesting and interactive. Whereas, the recorded lectures could be dry at times. Overall, Clare is a passionate professor who gives detailed feedback and is constantly trying to get the best out of her students. Highly recommend taking classes with her.

One of the best profs at SFU. Super understanding and engaging. The 2 assignments were fairly easy and pretty interesting in my opinion. The midterm and final were a bit of a struggle but if you enjoy the topic, participate in tutorial, and attend office hours you should do well.

Clare is amazing. She is very knowledgeable and really cares about her students. Separatist movements is a really interesting subject and our major assignment was to engage in a simulation about Scotland seceding from the UK. Highly recommend this course to any poli sci or IR student.

One of the best profs at SFU (took 330&421w). Incredibly knowledgeable. Her seminar format is engaging, and I appreciate how she doesn't do upper div exams. Easy to get by with only skimming readings, but participation is important. Papers are long, but she is super accessible and REALLY helpful in office hours. Gives very detailed feedback.

I found the lectures quite boring, but I am not interested in poly-sci, so thats probably on me. The papers and assignments for the class are interesting and not graded too harshly, but the midterm and final were brutal. The fact that the exams were open book carried me to that beauty of an A.

I really enjoyed taking Clare's class and I would recommend her as a prof! She's a great lecturer, provides important resources for her students to succeed as well as truly cares about her students. I think she is very knowledgable about what she teaches and enjoys hearing opinions and ideas from students. One my favourite profs I've ever had!!!

While I have read on these rates that Clare is a good teacher but is a tough marker I really don't agree. She absolutely knows what she is talking about and always hs an answer but for a 100 level course, this is very tough to get an A in. The exams are brutal and Clare assumes everyone is understanding content even though they dont. good luck.

Final exam dropped me from an A to a B which was really stupid. I had a really good understanding of the course content and thought I was prepared for the final which I thought I did fairly well on the exam but it seems like they graded us as if we had 3 days to finish instead of 3 hours. Take this course with another prof.

Clare was a very passionate and engaging professor and was a great lecturer. The two assignments Id say were fair but the midterm and the final were insanely and unjustifiably difficult. The standard of quality of responses expected on tests is (what Id say is) beyond what a normal 100 level course is expected.

Just did the final and I thought it was okay it was exactly how I expected it to be and 3 hours seemed like a long time too. If you're good under pressure the exam shouldn't be too bad for you. It was difficult to articulate my ideas on the 3 essays but I hopefully she marks easy due to time pressure and it wouldn't be the same as regular essays

The final was not what I expected from a 100-level course. It was incredibly unfair how she expects students to finish 3 definition questions with examples, a long case study and 3 FULL essays within 3 hours. She's not a bad prof but how the exam was formatted is horrible. Don't take this class with her tbh

Most difficult and unfair final I have ever taken in my university career. Dont k is how she expects us to finish short answers, a case Analysis, and three FULL essays in 3 hours. Plus, most of the content on the final was never touched on in class, making it even more horrible then it already was!! Dont take this class!!

She is a nice British prof that is super knowledgeable, however, her final exam is so unreasonable. You get three hours to write three definitions, one long case study, and THREE ESSAYS. I did not even have enough time ended up writing absolute nonsense and poor quality of work.
The final was 3 hours long, did not give us enough time. The final will drop your mark, extremely hard

As a poli-sci Major who has taken UD courses, I think that this has to be one of the toughest finals I have written so far. I dont think that this was the best way to test our understanding of the course material. That being said, I can tell that Clare is passionate at what she does and I would still maybe consider taking another course with her.

I took this class as a first year, this is the first political science course I have taken and it was pretty difficult. The content was interesting and I really enjoyed tutorials. The assignments are tough to to do well on, but DONT GET ME STARTED ON THE EXAMS. MIdterm and final are open book online exams and were insanely hard.

The midterm was the most fair and easiest one I have ever taken! (take home, open book). Her grading is not tough, in fact the TA's graded most things and were very fair. Lots of things to get marks for in this class like presentation, participation, 2 written assignments. Exam however, was unfair and difficult. 3 essays are not do-able in 3 hours.

She had given us the hardest most unfair final ever. Not wnough time was given and for the life of you please do not take this course. This final was mentally draining and i dont want anyone else to go through that
Boring lectures. She uploades lecture notes on canvas so refer to them and read the textbook as well. Put some work in. Final Take-home exam is extremely brutal (has 3 essays!!)

Upper division classes (330, 332, 421W) are very interesting. Follow the assignment guides and you will do well. Always gives adequate written feedback for why you got a certain grade which you can use to improve future assignments. Don't be afraid to speak up in class. Clare is very accessible during office hours!

Pros: Her lectures are interesting and she's passionate about what she teaches. The marking was fair. Cons: The final exam was BRUTAL (everything else was fair). The course is hard boring for people who aren't interested in the Canadian court system and politics.
She's so Caring and she doesn't trick you with what's on the exam or how shell mark HIGHLY recommend her
Don't take it with her

Solid class, pretty easy and relaxed. The only complaint I have is that it is impossible to receive a higher mark than 87%. They save the 90% marks for those that "demonstrate masters degree type knowledge." This is very stupid as nobody whose taking a 100 level course is going to demonstrate masters degree type knowledge.
Extremely knowledgeable and well respected. Very nice, too!
I will not take anymore political science courses because of how boring this class is.

Dr. McGovern is passionate in what she teaches. However, she is a VERY tough grader. You've to to be precise and clear cut in her assignments. I believe that she uses anwers from students to supliment her own research papers.. it's just a doubt I have. Don't expect office hour from her.. very difficult to meet her in person. But she is very nice.

very organized prof! seems well interested in the course content, ready to help students. assignments took pretty long to write but she gave clear criteria. textbook readings pretty long, also had to analyze some court cases. lectures are a bit boring but not too boring bc she encourages you to discuss a lot. overall pretty cool prof

She was a great prof. She was well prepared and was very well spoken. The course material was dry, so the lectures were a bit boring, but that isn't her problem. The course was nicely laid out (midterm worth 10%, two papers, and a take-home exam) FYI, the take-home exam has 3 essays along with all the other questions, with 3hrs to take it

I dont know if it was Clare or the course material, but this class was extremely dull. She reads DIRECTLY off of the slide notes that she posts online. That makes showing up seem entirely pointless, so I just didnt. You dont need to show up to do well, just show up for tutorials and do the assignments and youre fine.

Clare is one of the best professors in the department, she is great at facilitating discussions in class which makes the material more interesting. She will learn everyones name within a week. I have taken multiple classes with her and would highly reccomend her, she is very well respected and I have rarely heard a negative comment about her.

Clare was a nice prof. Just so boring. Found the lectures and all readings super dry. It might just be the class. It was just so boring I could barely stay awake in lecture. Also you must do the readings as in tutorial you may be called on to explain what the readings were about. Overall, I did not enjoy this class at all.

Clare is very fair and easy to get help from outside of class. She is obviously very caring and learned almost names within a week or two. The content can be boring at times (especially in the textbook) but Clare makes it much more interesting.

Her British accent is interesting to listen to. She makes the subject interesting. We had a guest lecturer but he wasn't as captivating as her. midterm was fairly easy. Past halfway through the semester and I'm basically done with everything, but this class is still genuinely interesting. Strict criteria, but but very helpful with questions

Clare is one of my favourite professors in the department. She is super approachable and genuinely cares about students success. She is excellent at facilitating class discussions, which makes the class go by fast. Just make an effort and follow the criteria and youll do well.

Great prof. Incorporates a lot of group work and discussion into lecture to make it interesting. Fair marker and provides lots of good feedback in office hours. 10/10 would recommend taking any of her classes.

Clare is a great prof that communicates well and is passionate about what she teaches. If you're a political science student, you will love any class you take with her. Some polisci classes tend to be dull but she has always made them interesting. She speaks on her experiences which is interesting, and she is also very neutral which is rare.

Clare is a really tough but really fair prof. She is incredibly kind, willing to help her students outside of class, and really wants everyone to succeed. The workload for this class was heavy, and she moves through the materials very quickly, but her lectures are very clear and very knowledgeable. I would absolutely take another class with her!

Clare put people on the spot and could sometimes be unclear but class environment was very professional, respectful, and positive. Everyone dreaded the group project but it ended up being a lot of fun and very helpful. Quizzes were surprisingly difficult. If you care even a little bit about poli sci, she will sense it and love you.

I'm pretty sure this was Clare's first time teaching at SFU, but she was amazing! Her lectures were always very organized  with a slide on the class structure. Easy speak to and access outside of class. Very mature, fair, and helps every student feel welcome in the class! If you have the option, take a class with her! A very knowledgeable prof!

This course was enjoyable and not very difficult, but it definitely caters toward students with a keen interest in political studies. Clare is a very knowledgeable professor, though she tends to spend too much time explaining examples to accompany her points while lecturing. Her and the TAs were extremely helpful in providing advice, and very fair.

Clare is incredibly kind, accessible and professional. As a political science professor, she is surprisingly neutral and really knows how to generate discussion. Would highly recommend any student who actually cares to take courses with her, as she really knows her stuff from law to politics to history.
